creator: gb@opengroup.org
text:
I believe that Tomcat should NOT pick up the CLASSPATH of the User that starts 
the Tomcat process.  This has caused me a large amount of pain and I don't 
believe it should be the mechanism for how Tomcat finds classes.  I have been 
placing "global" jar files in the tomcat/lib directory and that works fine, 
but with it picking up the User CLASSPATH value it has caused strange results.

The startup script and the lib directory should be the only places it gains 
it's CLASSPATH from.

creator: rafial@well.com
text:
I can add one specific example of where this causes problems.  I've been tearing
my hair out over Tomcat intermittently being unable to find classes in jar files
in the WEB-INF/lib directory.  Turns out that "." was in my CLASSPATH, and
occasionally I would start Tomcat while my current directory was the
WEB-INF/classes directory, thus placing that into my CLASSPATH, and causing my
application classes to be loaded by the wrong classloader, making them unable to
see classes in the lib/*.jar files.

creator: nacho@apache.org
text:
Fixed in Tomcat 3.3 and Tomcat 4.0..

In that versions Tomcat completely ignore the CLASSPATH present at startup.
